item.title: 据说沙特基金有意为新货运航空公司引进波音和空客飞机
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金正在进行试探性谈判，为一家新的货运航空公司准备波音公司和空中客车公司的货机，因为该基金希望将沙特阿拉伯王国打造成一个物流枢纽，与迪拜和多哈相抗衡。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is in exploratory talks to line up Boeing Co. and Airbus SE freighters for a new cargo airline, as it looks to turn the kingdom into a logistics hub to rival Dubai and Doha.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 运通卡将目光投向非洲，吸引用户放弃使用现金
item.description: 美国运通公司（American Express Co.【原文：American Express Co. is hunting for ways to make inroads in the last place on earth where cash is still king — the continent of Africa.】

item.title: 中国黄金进口再次下滑，创纪录的价格令买家望而却步
item.description: 由于创纪录的价格和持续的经济放缓抑制了全球最大金银购买国的需求，中国消费者上个月继续减少购买黄金。【原文：Chinese consumers continued to pull back on gold purchases last month, as record prices and a sustained economic slowdown curbed demand in the world’s biggest bullion-buying nation.】

item.title: 澳大利亚与印尼就被视为 "重要基石 "的防务条约达成一致
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼.阿尔巴尼塞表示，他已与印尼就一项新的防务协定达成一致，两国都希望在争议日益激烈的亚太地区加强安全关系。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said he’s agreed on a new defense pact with Indonesia as both nations aim to bolster security ties in an increasingly contested Asia-Pacific region.】

item.title: 反倾销调查可能提振印度钢铁企业股票
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 花旗称 "这次不同以往"，铁矿石将延续跌势
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc）降低了铁矿石的价格预测，并表示市场动态已经发生变化，随着中国钢铁企业减产，铁矿石的跌幅有望扩大到每吨 80 美元。【原文：Iron ore is poised to extend declines into the $80s-a-ton range as China’s steelmakers reduce production, according to Citigroup Inc., which pared price forecasts and said that market dynamics have shifted.】

item.title: 2024 年最热门债券交易之一在关键收益率指标附近停滞不前
item.description: 印度 10 年期国债收益率在创下 2022 年以来的最低水平后跌势停滞。【原文：The drop in India’s 10-year bond yield is stalling after hitting its lowest level since 2022.】

item.title: 黄金创纪录突破 2500 美元，接下来会发生什么？
item.description: 在美联储准备下调美国利率的预期下，黄金价格突破每盎司 2,500 美元，创下历史新高。【原文：Gold is in record-setting form, topping $2,500 an ounce on expectations that the Federal Reserve is poised to cut US interest rates.】

item.title: Seven & I 收购将成为日本收购的分水岭
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. 提议收购 Seven & i Holdings Co.【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.’s proposed acquisition of Seven & i Holdings Co., if successful, wouldn’t just be the largest takeover of a Japanese company, it would also be extremely rare.】

item.title: Kaisa 与债权人集团签订重组支持协议
item.description: 凯撒集团控股有限公司（Kaisa Group Holdings Ltd.）与一个重要的债权人团体达成了重组支持协议，这一举措可能有助于这家中国开发商抵御正在进行的清算申请。【原文：Kaisa Group Holdings Ltd. struck a restructuring support agreement with a key creditor group, a step that may help the Chinese developer defend itself against an ongoing liquidation petition.】

item.title: 中国人民银行发出谨慎信号后，中国银行维持主要贷款利率不变
item.description: 由于利润率面临压力，且政策制定者关注金融机构的健康状况，中国各银行维持 8 月份基准贷款利率不变。【原文：Chinese banks kept their benchmark lending rates unchanged for August, as profit margins come under pressure and policymakers focus on the health of financial institutions.】

item.title: 海外基金因美联储鸽派押注而重返印尼债券市场
item.description: 在美联储即将降息之际，海外投资者纷纷涌入印尼盾债券市场，印尼债券市场的资金外流将在今年得以消除。【原文：Indonesia’s bond market is set to erase its outflows for the year as overseas investors pile into rupiah debt amid imminent interest-rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 鲍威尔杰克逊霍尔演讲前黄金稳定在 2,500 美元上方
item.description: 本周晚些时候，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）将发表备受瞩目的讲话，他的讲话可能会为央行以多快的速度降息提供线索，在此之前，黄金在纪录高点附近持稳。【原文：Gold was steady near a record high before a hotly anticipated speech by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell later in the week, which may offer clues on how rapidly the central bank will cut interest rates.】

item.title: 中国放松限购引发新房价格快速下跌
item.description: 随着地方政府减少干预，开发商竞相回笼资金，一场价格战正在中国新房市场蔓延。【原文：A price war is spreading across China’s new-home market, as local governments dial back on intervention and developers race to recoup cash.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长雷恩称增长风险增强 9 月减息理由
item.description: 欧洲央行管理委员会成员奥利-雷恩（Olli Rehn）表示，欧洲经济增长前景面临的风险不断增加，这加强了欧洲央行在下月召开会议时进行政策调整的理由。【原文：Increasing risks to Europe’s growth outlook have reinforced the case for a policy adjustment when the European Central Bank meets next month, according to Governing Council member Olli Rehn.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。股市连续第八天攀升，创下今年以来最长连胜纪录。莫迪计划访问基辅。新加坡计划对公共住房实行新的限制。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Stocks climb for eighth day in longest winning streak this year. Modi is scheduled to visit Kyiv. Singapore plans to introduce new curbs on public housing. Here’s what’s moving markets. —Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 美国推动加沙停火势头强劲，石油保持跌势
item.description: 由于美国称以色列接受了停止加沙战争的停火建议，石油创下两周多来的最大跌幅，这可能会缓解对需求前景的担忧所带来的供应风险。【原文：Oil held the biggest drop in more than two weeks as the US said Israel accepted a cease-fire proposal to halt the war in Gaza, potentially easing supply risks as concerns about the demand outlook mount.】

item.title: 亚洲股市将从看涨的华尔街获得提振：市场综述
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市将在日本基准股市的带动下上涨，此前华尔街股市表现强劲，美国 500 指数（S&P 500）连续第八天上涨，创下今年以来最长连涨纪录。【原文：Asian stocks are set to gain Tuesday, led by Japan’s benchmark, following a buoyant session on Wall Street where the S&P 500 advanced for an eighth straight day — the longest winning streak this year.】

item.title: 多伦多、蒙特利尔和温哥华的乘客面临铁路罢工的干扰
item.description: 从周四开始，加拿大最大城市的工人上下班可能会更加困难，因为如果公司和工会之间不能达成协议，加拿大最大的两条铁路将停运。【原文：Workers in Canada’s largest cities may have a more difficult commute starting Thursday, as the country’s two largest railways are set to shut down if a deal isn’t reached between the companies and the union.】

item.title: 沙特证券交易所期待亚洲投资者提高流动性
item.description: 沙特证券交易所正寻求亚洲投资者来促进中东最大市场的交易活动。【原文：The Saudi stock exchange is looking to Asian investors to bolster activity in the Middle East’s largest market.】

item.title: Amundi 表示，随着历史性疲软的结束，日元将升值至 140 点
item.description: Amundi SA 预计，随着日元历史性疲软的结束，日元将反弹至 2023 年 7 月的水平。【原文：Amundi SA expects the yen to rally to levels last seen in July 2023 as its historic weakness comes to an end.】

item.title: Steward 指责业主 MPT 干涉医院销售工作
item.description: 破产医院运营商 Steward Health Care System 指控其房东 Medical Properties Trust Inc.【原文：Bankrupt hospital operator Steward Health Care System accused its landlord Medical Properties Trust Inc. of improperly interfering with a court-approved plan to sell some properties to pay off creditors.】

item.title: 格罗尔称，房地产下滑带来几十年来最佳机遇
item.description: 芝加哥一位杰出的房地产开发商说，现在是那些有资本的人逆势投资商业房地产的时候了。【原文：One of Chicago’s preeminent real estate developers says now is the time for those with capital to make a contrarian bet and invest in commercial real estate.】

item.title: 美国向加拿大小公司 Electra 提供 2,000 万美元用于建设钴工厂
item.description: 加拿大 Electra Battery Materials 公司获得了美国政府 2000 万美元的奖励，用于在北美汽车中心地带附近建设一家钴工厂。【原文：Canada’s Electra Battery Materials Corp. has received a $20 million award from the US government to build a cobalt plant close to North America’s automotive heartland.】

item.title: Circle K 的交易机器通过竞购 7-Eleven 进入高速运转阶段
item.description: Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc. 对 7-Eleven 连锁便利店母公司的收购，是这家靠一桩又一桩交易起家的公司迄今为止最雄心勃勃的想法。【原文：Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc.’s approach to the parent company of the 7-Eleven convenience store chain is the most ambitious idea yet by a company that was built on making one deal after another.】

item.title: 量子资本以 18 亿美元收购 Caerus 石油天然气公司
item.description: Quantum Capital Group 以约 18 亿美元（含负债）的价格收购了 Caerus Oil and Gas。【原文：Quantum Capital Group has acquired Caerus Oil and Gas for about $1.8 billion including liabilities.】

item.title: 期权交易员在杰克逊霍尔会议前对冲美元损失
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在杰克逊霍尔（Jackson Hole）举行的央行年度会议上将强化降息的理由，期权交易商押注美元将进一步下跌。【原文：Options traders are positioning for further dollar losses amid bets that Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will reinforce the case for interest-rate cuts during the central bank’s annual gathering in Jackson Hole.】

item.title: 金条首次价值百万美元
item.description: 有史以来第一次，一根金条价值一百万美元。【原文：For the first time ever, a bar of gold is worth a cool one million dollars.】

item.title: 尼日利亚欠国家石油公司 49 亿美元燃油补贴债务
item.description: 尼日利亚国有石油公司今年计划收取的汽油补贴收入中，有将近一半是拖欠的。【原文：Nigeria owes its state-owned oil company almost half of what it plans to collect in revenues this year for a gasoline subsidy it reintroduced in August.】
